IX.iii.1.J.1.h
.
Definition:  Fair Market Value
Fair market value
is the price at which an asset would change hands between a willing buyer and seller.
Note
:  VA will use the best available information to determine fair market value, such as inspections, appraisals, public records, and the market value of similar property.
Reference
:  For more information on fair market value, see
38 CFR 3.276(a)(4)
, and
M21-1, Part IX, Subpart iii, 1.J.5.c
.
